meanings.definition: A flight of an aircraft over a particular area.
meanings.sent1: During the flypast, the planes flew in formation over the city.
meanings.sent2: The flypast at the airshow was truly spectacular.
meanings.sent3: The flypast of geese overhead made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The flypast of shooting stars lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The flypast of colorful kites added joy to the festival.

meanings.definition: To fly over a particular area or event.
meanings.sent1: The birds will flypast the park on their migration journey.
meanings.sent2: The military jets will flypast the stadium during the national anthem.
meanings.sent3: I will flypast your house on my way to the store.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams seemed to flypast the clouds and reach the stars.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day flypast my mind like a whirlwind.
